p: Other than the inhibition zone, the antibacterial activity was also presented as minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) and minimum bactericidal concentration (MBC). MIC is defined as the lowest concentration of samples that inhibits microbial growth. Meanwhile, MBC is the lowest sample concentration at which 99.9% of the bacteria are killed [ 23]. For easier comparison, the MIC and MBC values from published articles were recalculated from μg/mL, mg/mL, and µg/µL to percentage ( w/ v or v/ v).
